meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dank.
meanings.sent1: The danknesses of the basement made it a perfect place for mushrooms to grow.
meanings.sent2: The danknesses of the cave added to its mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: Despite the danknesses of the room, we decided to stay for the night.
meanings.sent4: The danknesses of the forest enveloped us like a cool, damp blanket.
meanings.sent5: The danknesses of the old library filled the air with a musty scent.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being unpleasantly damp and cold.
meanings.sent1: The danknesses of the cellar made it uncomfortable to spend time there.
meanings.sent2: The danknesses of the fog chilled us to the bone.
meanings.sent3: We shivered in the danknesses of the abandoned building.
meanings.sent4: The danknesses of the morning air seeped into our clothes.
meanings.sent5: The danknesses of the room made it feel like a refrigerator.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being musty or moldy.
meanings.sent1: The danknesses of the old books reminded me of my grandmother's attic.
meanings.sent2: The danknesses of the basement triggered my allergies.
meanings.sent3: We wrinkled our noses at the danknesses of the damp towels.
meanings.sent4: The danknesses of the abandoned house made me sneeze uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The danknesses of the cheese indicated it was past its expiration date.
